page.title: 19HEAVY TRAFFIC ON RURAL ROADS
page.content:
There are no major or 'A' roads running through the area. The B5017 and the B5324 join at the New Inn junction.
It is increasingly common for heavy vehicles to use minor roads as short cuts to classified roads. This often causes erosion of grass verges and destruction of road surfaces on narrow lanes not made to carry heavy traffic. It also causes danger to cyclists, horse-riders and pedestrians as there are almost no footpaths.
Some heavy traffic is necessary to service farms, public houses and the garage, but to preserve rural roads it is desirable to introduce legislation prohibiting their use by heavy vehicles except for access.
